column5: Can i have two lines in the water at the same time? What i mean to do is to put a rod on stand and throw jigs from the other one.
depends on where you are fishing.
The answer then is no. From a boat you can but not from shore. I know, it makes no sense.
Rick I cant find where it says you cant. Lake Ontario is lake ontario. I dont see why not.  We need an ask the CO
Under the general exceptions it says you can fish with two rods from a boat.
I've been present SEVERAL TIMES when guys fishing Lake Ontario for carp, with 2 rods were picked off . . .     definitely a no-no, unless in a boat or on the ice!
Page 8 in section b of the regs found here http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/pubs/fishing/...ap_B_fr2005.pdf states..
Ya know....  that makes no sense at all to me...
Thanks soo much for the responses. I guess its a no..no for two rods.
I asked this last year, and it seems that if you're say standing on a pier, you can have one line.  Drop your canoe in the water 1 foot from where you were standing and two is ok...LOL
